context.title: BIRT Chart contexts
context.description: Contexts for chart items identified by Actuate, 06/2009

context.title: Area Format
context.description: The plot area of a chart with axes includes the axes and the area within the axes. The plot area of a chart without axes, such as a pie or meter chart, includes the client area, which contains the chart.

topic.label: How to modify the plot area

context.title: Custom Properties
context.description:
A custom property associates a value or expression with each instance of a chart. Use a custom property in an event handler to modify the default behavior of a chart.
To add a custom property, type a name in the text box below the list of custom properties. Then, choose Add Next, type a value or expression to set the initial value of the custom property.
To use the custom property in an event handler, write code similar to the following line: chart.getExtendedProperties().get(0).getValue()

context.title: General Properties
context.description:
General properties define the standard features for the current chart type.
You can use the general properties in an event handler by calling the chart's getter methods.

context.title: Curve Fitting Line
context.description:
A curve fitting line displays a curve that passes through all the points on a chart with axes. You use this line to estimate the values between those that appear on the chart.
On Curve Fitting Line, set the appearance of the line. You can add a title to the line, with an optional outline.

context.title: Series Labels
context.description: Series labels display values related to the point on the chart. For example, you can show the percentage of the total that the point represents.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Filters
context.description:
A filter restricts the set of records to include in a chart. A filter does not restrict the set of records in the data set itself. For example, you can create filters to select customers in a certain region, or customers with a certain credit rank.
Choose Add to add a new filter. Filters are applied in the order that they appear in the list. If you have more than one filter, you can choose Up or Down to reorder the selected filter.

context.title: Parameters
context.description:
A parameter restricts the set of records in a data set based on the value of an individual field. If a data set provides a parameter, you can set a value or expression to define the records that you require. The value or expression must return a value of the correct data type for the field from the data set.
If a data set does not provide parameters, you can restrict the values that the chart displays by using Filter.

context.title: Hyperlink Options
context.description: A hyperlink can link a part of a chart to a web site, another location within the same report, or a location within a different report.

context.title: Expression Builder - Specify Data Definition
context.description: Create expressions using a combination of constants, controls, functions, literal values, names of fields, and operators that evaluate to a single value.

topic.label: Writing Expressions

context.title: Externalize Text
context.description: Externalizing text supports localization of static string values into multiple languages.

topic.label: Localizing text

context.title: Format Chart: Chart Area
context.description: The chart area includes the plot area, the title area, the legend area, and the axes if the chart uses axes.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance
Change the chart title
How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Format Chart: Axis
context.description: A chart axis can display ticks, labels, and a title to inform a user about the values on the chart.

topic.label: How to set the data type and format of an axis

context.title: Format Chart: Legend
context.description: A chart legend displays a key of category colors and names to assist a user in interpreting chart values.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Format Chart: Plot
context.description: The plot area of a chart with axes includes the axes and the area within the axes. The plot area of a chart without axes, such as a pie or meter chart, includes the client area, which contains the chart.

topic.label: How to modify the plot area
How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Format Chart: Series
context.description:
A series is a set of related values. On a chart with axes, category series relate to the x-axis and value series map to the y-axis. On a pie chart, a slice appears for each item in a category series. The value series sets the size of each slice.
You can set general series properties, such as title, visibility, and the set of colors to use for slices and bars.

context.title: Format Chart: X-Axis
context.description:
The x-axis displays values for a category series. Its values can be of any data type. Use this page to specify title, type, position of the x-axis with respect to the y-axis, and labels.
For additional formatting options, choose Scale, Title, Label, Gridlines, Markers, and Interactivity.

context.title: Format Chart: Category Series
context.description: The category series determines the number of slices in a pie chart. Its values can be of any data type. To combine the slices for categories having values below a threshold into a single slice, type a value in Minimum Slice. Then, in Slice Label, type text to use as the category label for the combined slice.

context.title: Format Chart: Value Series, Radar Charts
context.description: The spokes of a radar chart display values for a value series. The values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the lines joining the values in the chart. You can add labels and fill the polygons between values in the value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Interactivity, Radar Line, Web Labels, and Category Labels to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Bar Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the bar outlines in the chart. You can add labels and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Cone Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the cone outlines in the chart. You can add labels and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Pyramid Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the pyramid outlines in the chart. You can add labels and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Tube Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the tube outlines in the chart. You can add labels and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Area Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the line that delimits the value series area in the chart. You can add labels, markers, and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Markers, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Line Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the line in the chart. To join the line when there are no values, for example, for a day in a category series of dates, select Connect Missing Values. You can add labels, markers, and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Markers, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value Series, Pie Charts
context.description: The value series determines the size of slices in a pie chart. Its values must be numeric.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Format Chart: Value Series, Meter Charts
context.description: The value series determines the position of the needle in a meter chart. Its values must be numeric. Use this page to format the appearance of the dial and the needle. You can add labels to value series for this chart type. Use the Dial Labels, Needles, Regions, Ticks, Scale, and Interactivity buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Scatter Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the markers in the chart. If you select Visible, in Line, a scatter chart behaves similarly to a line chart. You can add labels, markers, and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Markers, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Stock Charts
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be numeric. Use this page to format the box color and candlestick line in the chart. You can add labels and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format: Value (Y) Series, Bubble Chart
context.description: The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to format the markers in the chart. If you select Visible, in Line, a bubble chart behaves similarly to a line chart. You can add labels, markers, and a curve-fitting line to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Markers, Curve Fitting Line, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Difference Chart
context.description: The y-axis displays two related values for a value series. Their values are of the same numeric, date, or date-and-time types. The chart displays two related line plots with a colored band between them. Select the format and color of the line to display for the positive and negative series. By default, the lines between points are straight. Select Show Lines as Curves to display curved lines. You can add labels and markers to value series for this chart type. Use Labels, Positive Markers, Negative Markers, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the value series.

context.title: Format Chart: Value (Y) Series, Gantt Chart
context.description:
Typically, Gantt charts represent project schedules and tasks using bars that correlate to beginning and ending dates. You can color-code the bars to show status, for example.
You can format the bars and use markers for the start and end dates.
For additional formatting options, choose Labels, Task Labels, and Interactivity.

context.title: Edit Format
context.description: The format of a label depends on its data type.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Gridlines
context.description: Grid lines are a set of lines that run parallel to an axis at fixed values, such as the start of each month, or multiples of a million. These lines provide a reference for chart users to see how a plotted value relates to that set of values. You can hide, display, or customize the selected axis line and grid lines.

context.title: Hyperlink Editor
context.description: In Name, type a name, then choose Edit base URL to set the URL properties.

context.title: Hyperlink Options
context.description: Use Hyperlink Menu Properties to provide the user with the option to select from multiple hyperlinks.

context.title: Interactivity
context.description: Interactivity is a response to a user action, such as clicking or moving the mouse over a chart or a part of a chart.

context.title: Legend Layout
context.description: A chart legend displays a key of category colors and names to assist a user in interpreting chart values. You can locate the legend with reference to other parts of the chart and modify its appearance. Position places the legend relative to the plot area. Anchor places the key within the legend block. Stretch specifies how the text fills the available space. You can change the background color of the legend block from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the legend. Set wrapping width to a non-zero value to enable wrapping of key text. Max Percent defines the maximum space that the legend occupies within the chart area. Insets set the minimum distance of the key from the edge of the legend block. Use insets to control the spacing between the legend and the plot area

context.title: Markers
context.description: A marker is a line or pair of lines that runs parallel to an axis at a fixed value, such as the start of a particular year, or the range 500 to 600. The line provides a reference for chart users to see how a plotted value relates to that marker. You can hide, display, or customize the marker lines.

context.title: New Data Set
context.description: A data set provides the values on a chart.

topic.label: Build a data set

context.title: Outline
context.description: An outline is a border around any part of a chart. You can change the thickness, visibility, and color of the outline of the chart area.

context.title: Scale
context.description: A scale sets the range of numeric, date, or date-and-time values that an axis displays. By default, BIRT determines the scale of an axis based on the values that the axis displays. You can set the maximum and minimum values, and the step size or number of values to display on the axis.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Data
context.description: A chart displays series of data values associated with a single data set. A pie or meter chart displays category and value series. A chart with axes displays a single category series and one or more value series.

topic.label: Provide data for a chart

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Chart Type
context.description: A chart displays series of data values graphically. BIRT provides many chart types. Most chart types provide multiple sub-types.

topic.label: Add the chart to the report

context.title: Series Palette
context.description: The series palette defines the set of colors and their order for a series, such as the bars in a bar chart, or slices in a pie chart. You can set the number of available colors and the order in which they appear in the chart.

context.title: Edit Font
context.description:
Use this dialog box to format the font for a text item. When you change a font option, the change is displayed in the Preview text box.
You can set the orientation of the text item either by dragging the Rotation dial or by specifying degrees.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Text Format
context.description: The format of a text item, such as an axis title or point labels, provides the emphasis that you want the chart user to see. Position places the text relative to surrounding items. Stretch specifies how the text fills the available space. You can change the background and shadow of the text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the text. Insets set the minimum distance of the text from the edge of the text box. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the text and surrounding items.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Title Format
context.description: The format of a title provides the emphasis that you want the chart user to see. You can change the background and shadow of the text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the text. Insets set the minimum distance of the text from the edge of the text box. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the text and surrounding items.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Format Chart: Z-Axis
context.description: A z-axis displays extra value series or group values for a category series parallel to the x-axis in an appearance of depth. You can add a title and labels to the z-axis. Use Title, Labels, Gridlines, and Interactivity to refine the appearance and behavior of the z-axis.

context.title: Series Markers
context.description: Series markers are icons that mark each point on a chart. You can add, format, and remove series markers. BIRT charts support pre-defined marker shapes or custom markers from images that you provide.

context.title: Marker Icon Selector
context.description: BIRT charts support custom series markers from images that you provide. Specify the location from which to select the image.

context.title: Regions
context.description: The regions of a meter chart show ranges of values as different colors on the background of the meter. To show the region as a band of color, rather than a slice, specify the inner and outer radius.

context.title: Select Data Binding
context.description: Data binding provides a name for an expression. You use a named data binding in the same way as columns defined by a data set.

topic.label: Binding Data

context.title: Gradient Editor
context.description: A gradient merges smoothly from a starting color to an ending color in a specified direction across an area.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Positive and Negative Colors Editor
context.description: Positive values appear in one selected color and negative values in the other color.

context.title: Select Image
context.description: You can provide an image as the background to any part of a chart. For example, you can use a company logo as the background to a chart showing sales performance.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Format Chart Area Background
context.description: Select an available color or choose a button for further background formatting options.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Color
context.description: Select an available color or select Define Custom Colors for further color options.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Format Chart: Y-Axis
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types. Use this page to specify title, type, position of the y-axis with respect to the x-axis, and labels.
For additional formatting options, choose Scale, Title, Label, Gridlines, Markers, and Interactivity.

context.title: Format Chart: Title
context.description: A chart's title describes the entire chart. You can set the visibility and format the chart title. For additional formatting options, choose Text, Layout, and Interactivity.

topic.label: Change the chart title

context.title: Chart Title Text
context.description: The format of a title provides the emphasis that you want the chart user to see. The Anchor positions the chart title relative to the title block. Stretch specifies how the content of the title fills the available space. You can change the background and shadow of the title text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the title text. Insets set the minimum distance of the title text from the edge of the text box. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the chart title and the chart.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Title Layout
context.description: The title block is the area of of a chart that contains the chart title. You can change the location and appearance of the title block. The Anchor positions the chart title relative to the plot area. Stretch specifies how the content of the block fills the available space. You can change the background and shadow of the title block from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the title block. Insets set the minimum distance of the title text box from the edge of the title block. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the title block and the chart.

context.title: Chart Legend Title
context.description: A chart legend displays a key of category colors and names to assist a user in interpreting chart values. Position places the legend title relative to the key. Stretch specifies how the title fills the available space. You can change the background and shadow of the title text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the title. Insets set the minimum distance of the title text from the edge of the legend area. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the title and surrounding items.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Legend Entries
context.description: A chart legend displays a key of category colors and names to assist a user in interpreting chart values. You can change the background and shadow of the key text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the text. Insets set the minimum distance of the text from the edge of the text box. If necessary, the text wraps onto another line or displays an ellipsis to maintain the inset. Use insets to control the spacing between the text and surrounding items.

context.title: Dial Labels
context.description: Dial labels on a meter chart are similar to the labels that display values on an axis for other chart types. You can change the background and shadow of the title text from transparent, the default, to another color. Enable and format an outline to put a border round the text. Insets set the minimum distance of the text from surrounding items. If necessary, the text shows an ellipsis to maintain the inset. You can format the values that the labels show, for example, to provide thousands separators or set the number of digits after the decimal point for numeric values.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Dial Needles
context.description: On a meter chart, needles indicate the value of a value series. You can modify the color and style of the needle.

context.title: Grouping and Sorting
context.description: Sorting defines the order in which values appear in the category or value series. The default chart behavior uses the order in which the data set supplies values. Category or X series grouping combines multiple records to produce a single value on the chart. For example, you can group sales by month. Value or Y series grouping to define multiple sets of values. The chart legend provides a key to these sets. For example, you can display monthly sales by product type.

topic.label: How to group categories on the x-axis

context.title: Chart Examples
context.description: The Charting API examples include Java code for building several chart types using the Chart Engine API. Select an example to see a preview of the type of chart it constructs. Select Open to see the Java snippet in the code window. You can copy the code if you want. Save the XML code and study it to learn how to create a similar chart using the API.

context.title: Chart Preferences
context.description: Use this page to enable or disable interactive chart previews as you modify the chart definition. Use it also to set the maximum number of rows in the chart data preview on the Select Data page of the chart builder.

topic.label: How to change chart preview preferences

context.title: Chart Field Assist
context.description: Field assist provides visible identification of required fields in the chart builder. For example, Value (Y) Series is a required field in Select Data for a chart with axes. You can choose whether or not to identify required fields with a symbol, which is typically an asterisk (*). You can also specify the position of the symbol relative to the field.

context.title: Chart Content Assist
context.description: The content assist tool in the chart builder displays available values for fields for which you supply an expression. You can define the gesture that the chart developer makes to display the content assist tool. The default gesture is to type the ctrl-space character. You can also define the behavior of the content assist tool as the developer selects a value from the list or types characters.

context.title: Chart Content Assist
context.description: The content assist tool in the chart builder displays available values for fields for which you supply an expression. You can define the gesture that the chart developer makes to display the content assist tool. The default gesture is to type the ctrl-space character. You can also define the behavior of the content assist tool as the developer selects a value from the list or types characters.

context.title: Pattern Image Editor
context.description: Select a pattern and set its foreground and background colors.
